invention_record.description: This invention employs the use of B-diketones to form dihydropyridines and pyridines. Reaction of acetylacetone with ethyl B-amino crotonate for example would generate 2,4,6-triethyl nicotinic acid and 2,4,6-trimethyl nicotinates. These would be important for formation of 2,4,6-trimethyl nicotines. Other B-diketones and substituted B-amino crotonates would yield 2,4,6-trialkylnicotinic acids and their esters for formations of 2,4,6-trialkyl nicotines which could be converted to 2,4,6-trialkylnicotines by known paths.
invention_record.state_of_the_art: 2,4,6-trialkyl nicotinates, 2,4,6-trialkyl nicotinic acids, and 2,4,6-trialkylnicotines are unknown. All should have important biological activity.
